channel.title: Art Portfolio on James O'Toole
channel.description: Recent content in Art Portfolio on James O'Toole

item.title: Woman in Forest
item.description: A woman in a forest sits by a waterfall, staring at the sky.

item.title: Water Carrier
item.description: She pours water into the pond, surrounded by naturalistic abstract forms.

item.title: Water Carrier's Twin
item.description: She pours water from a vessel into a small pond surrounded by flowers.

item.title: Clock
item.description: Nipples are nostrils; the clock ticks; a woman sleeps; another woman sits.

item.title: Faces
item.description: A woman wears a hat; a man sits in an arm chair; a woman sits curled on the floor; faces stare.

item.title: Lay by Window
item.description: Painted and collaged bodies scattered through abstract linear forms.

item.title: PIA
item.description: A body floats; a woman sits; a goose stands; a man kisses another man’s head.

item.title: Obscene Colours Study
item.description: A life study for the Obscene Colours series.

item.title: Life Study
item.description: The model poses sat with extended leg.

item.title: Pouring Water Study 4
item.description: Fourth and final study of model pouring water for Obscene Colours series.

item.title: Pouring Water Study 3
item.description: Third study of model pouring water for Obscene Colours series.

item.title: Pouring Water Study 2
item.description: Second study of model pouring water for Obscene Colours series.

item.title: Pouring Water Study 1
item.description: First study of model posing pouring water for Obscene Colours series.

item.title: Standing Female Nude
item.description: A study of a female life model stood with hand on shoulder.

item.title: Turning Female Nude
item.description: A study from a life drawing session, the model turns to her left.

item.title: Cross Legged Meditation
item.description: A study from a life drawing session, the female model sits cross legged.

item.title: Stood Hand on Hip
item.description: A study from a life drawing session.

item.title: Sat on Stool
item.description: A nude female sits on a stool.

item.title: Study for Queen
item.description: The Queen chess piece, a study for the painting.

item.title: Laying Pondering
item.description: A study of a nude female laying on the floor, pondering thoughts.

item.title: Sat in Arm Chair
item.description: A colourful study of a nude female sitting in an arm chair with her head turned to her right.

item.title: Chaise Longue
item.description: A female nude figure lounges in an abstract place.

item.title: Snowflake Eye
item.description: A narrative of frames, stances of a woman, stand in a dream-like landscape.

item.title: Colourful Floating Sun
item.description: Nude forms; collage and colourful abstract forms, cross and collide.

item.title: Stone Leaping Lung
item.description: Collaged objects dot the canvas, weaved with coloured abstractions.

item.title: Max Reclining
item.description: Drawing inspiration from abstract expressionism, but complementing it with a more realistic depiction of a nude.

item.title: Green Man
item.description: An alien figure squats, surrounded by foreign light.

item.title: Empyrean
item.description: Inspired by Gustave Dor√©’s depiction of the Empyrean from Dante’s Divine Comedy

item.title: The Gender Series
item.description: A composition of 10 canvases to form the gender series.

item.title: Forbidden Fruit
item.description: The snake tempts you to eat the forbidden fruit. Will you Fall?

item.title: Mars and Venus
item.description: The Greek gods of masculinity and femininity, Mars and Venus, hold a spear and a mirror respectively.

item.title: He is called James
item.description: A self portrait of the artist shortly after shaving off his long hair.

item.title: Up Side Down
item.description: A demon’s face distorts in a circular fashion, round the square canvas. Did you hang the painting up side down?

item.title: Two Spiders
item.description: A still life, featuring a variety of man-made objects.

item.title: Twisted Laughter
item.description: A distorted face, with twisted eye and mouth.

item.title: Man with raised knee
item.description: The viewer looks over the shoulder of a male nude.

item.title: Woman with raised knee
item.description: An expressive sketch of a female nude.

item.title: They are called Max
item.description: An androgynous portrait of Max. Max is trans-gender and prefers the use the pronoun “they”, in it’s singular form. Whilst sitting they were illuminated from their left by a green light.

item.title: His Arm
item.description: The arm grasps a pole marked with chevrons: symbolizing his weapon. The drips of ink from his arm infer blood. However, the depiction of a masculine warrior is undermined by his lactating nipple.

item.title: He is called James
item.description: A self portrait of the artist. The enlarged eye is centrally placed in the square canvas. The eyes, lips and hair take a more realistic form, whilst the face is composed of colourful geometric shapes.

item.title: He is called Matt
item.description: The cover art for the, newly released, “Salvation” EP by Matt under the pseudonym “Hope for All”. The geometric style is inspired by the electronic style of “Salvation”.

item.title: She is called Kira
item.description: A portrait of Kira shortly after James cut her long hair into a short and masculine style. The masculine haircut and feminine dress create an androgynous appearance that conflicts with common gender stereotypes.

item.title: The Queen
item.description: An elegant depiction of the Queen chess piece with three chevrons at her head. The chevrons are symbolic of Mars: the God of War and masculinity.

item.title: The King's Toy
item.description: The King chess piece is depicted with a cross at his head. The cross additionally features in “toy”, forming an inverted symbol of Venus. Among the graffiti community, a “king” is a highly regarded graffiti artist and “toy” is a derogatory term. Painting the word “toy” over a graffiti piece is a mark of disrespect.
